de.tif.jacob.screen.event
Class IBreadCrumbEventHandler

java.lang.Object
  de.tif.jacob.event.EventHandler
      de.tif.jacob.screen.event.GuiEventHandler
          de.tif.jacob.screen.event.IGroupMemberEventHandler
              de.tif.jacob.screen.event.IBreadCrumbEventHandler

public abstract class IBreadCrumbEventHandler
extends IGroupMemberEventHandler

Abstract event handler class for non-action buttons. Derived implementations of this event handler class have to be used to "hook" application-specific business logic to buttons.

Since:
2.8.0

Method Detail

onGroupStatusChanged

public final void onGroupStatusChanged(IClientContext context,
                                       IGuiElement.GroupState state,
                                       IGuiElement element)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from class: IGroupMemberEventHandler
This event method will be called, if the status of the corresponding group has been changed. It can be a TabPane or the top level group.
Note: A TabPane doesn't receive the onGroupStatusChanged event of a top level group.
Derived event handlers could overwrite this method, e.g. to enable/disable GUI elements in relation to the group state.
Possible group state values are defined in IGuiElement:
  • IGuiElement.UPDATE
  • IGuiElement.NEW
  • IGuiElement.SEARCH
  • IGuiElement.SELECTED

Overrides:
onGroupStatusChanged in class IGroupMemberEventHandler
Parameters:
context - The current client context
state - The new group state
element - The corresponding GUI element to this event handler
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
#onOuterGroupStatusChanged(IClientContext, GroupState, IGuiElement)

onClick

public void onClick(IClientContext context,
                    java.lang.String pathToSegment,
                    java.lang.String segment,
                    IBreadCrumb emitter)
             throws java.lang.Exception
Will be called if the user click on the bread crumb element.

Parameters:
context - the current working context of the application
pathToSegment - the left hand side path of the selected element. Always ends with the delimiter character of the breadcrumb
segment - the clicked segment
emitter - the emitter element of the event
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
